Derivatives must be credited to "To Enter Africa from America", made available non-commercially, and distributed under the same terms. Requests for permission for commercial publication or other use should be emailed to the project team.

bibl.title: Despatches from United States Consuls in Gaboon, 1856-1888 T-466

text.body:
United States Commercial Agency at Gaboon November 10th 1896
Hon. John. L. Cadvalader Assistant Secretary of State Washington D.C.
Sir;
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your dispatch No 46, hearing date August 17th 1876, It was not received at this office, till mondau October 30th.
I regret exceedingly, the action of Congress, that has rendered it necessary to discontinue the office of Commercial Agent at Gaboon. The removal of our flag- proud symbol of liberity + right-before Gaboon, where it has so long floated. will be prejudical to American Commerce and especially to the philanthropic and Christianizing enterprise of the America Mission which extends about 100 miles both north.
and
and South of Gaboon; and nearly 200 miles into the interior of Africa. With sadness I hasten to comply with your instruction to close the office and render final accounts, resewing for another dispatch, a request, which M.J.H. Reading and myself purpose to make to the Department, that we be permitted to retain the archives, and resume the function of the Commercial Agency, receiving only the Fees for our services.
The last mail, I transmitted my return and accounts for the Quarter ending September 20th, but drew no drafts for salary or other expenses. A new salary Account, will be forwarded to the Fifth Auditory of the Treasury.
My salary from July 1st, to September 20th amounts $220.10. Since July 1st. I have received from this as already returned $21.96. Deducting this amount and also $20.00 "extra wages" on hands from the salary credit; there remain $178.16; for which amount I have
drawn a draft upon the Monetary of the Treasury.
During the period of my service as Commercial Agent, i have presented no account for rent, and miscelllaneous expenses; as my predecesors in the office, were accounted ti di; and haave now none to render. The archives are safely kept in an iron house. and as soon as my health will permit, I will take a careful inventory, of them, and sent a copy to the department of State per maid.
The earliest sade, and direct opportunity to senf the archives to the United States, will be several months hences; and in the mean time, we hope to receive permission to retain them, and continue the Agency time of transit hence to the United States; I am sorry to inform you, that my medical advisor - under whose care I have been dawning the last two months decided against my leaving at present. I have already requested of the Department, leave of absence early next year; + stil hope I maybe able to leave by that times + should the provision referred to be extended till that time, I shall be glad to avail myself of it.
I have now completed a third of a century of toils+ sacrifice in Western Africa in philanthropies + christian work- the abolition of the Slave trade + the introduction of Christian Civilization into this dark land. My life has been almost miraculously present , + now I heluis I remain alone, the only white man on the coast who was here 33 years ago, when I arrived. During this period to have been
encouraging
encouraging to write the subtle time of comerce in the Slave Trade, the rapid exploration of the country is the introdution of christian civilization with its incetionable blessings.
Permit one to express my thanks to the offices of the Department of State, for their country to one during the period I have held the Commercial Agency.
Should my health be restored, by a brief visit to the United States; I hope to return and resume my labors here; and we trust on mission house will continue to be a refuge for every American citizen who may visit the Gaboon; whether we have the right to render official assistance as such.
With great respect, Sir, I remain, Your obedient Servant Albert Bushwell U.S.C.Agent
